A sexually active 18-year-old woman has had a fever of 38.9°C for the past 24 hours as well as a 5-day history of lower abdominal pain and anorexia. Physical examination shows generalized tenderness of the abdomen erythema of the cervix, and motion tenderness. There are no lesions on the external genitalia. Microscopic examination of the cervical discharge shows sloughed epithelial cells and scant neutrophils Which of the following additional findings will most likely be found on examination of the discharge?

options.label: A
options.text: Intranuclear inclusion bodies surrounded by halos

questions.text: A 26-year-old man comes to the emergency department because of an ulcerative genital lesion. The lesion first appeared 1 month ago as a papule with a red base and then became ulcerated and painful. His temperature is 38.2°C. Physical examination shows an ulcerative lesion on the prepuce, with unilateral inguinal adenopathy as shown in the image. Microscopic examination of scrapings from the lesion will most likely show which of the following?

options.label: C
options.text: Pleomorphic gram-negative rods in parallel short chains

questions.correct_answer: C. Pleomorphic gram-negative rods in parallel short chains

questions.text: A two-week-old male new-born develops fever, lethargy, and seizures. The infant was born at term with no obstetric or early postnatal complications. His temperature is 39.1°C, blood pressure is 100/80 mm Hg, pulse is 140/min and respirations are 30/min, with an oxygen saturation of 98%. Physical examination shows sunken eyes and bulging fontanelles. The patient has a poor suck reflex and is slightly hypotonic. Examination of cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) obtained on lumbar puncture shows a high neutrophil count and gram-positive cocci in chains. Which of the following is characteristic of the most likely causal organism?

A 4-year-old girl is brought to the emergency department because of a fever and severe pain in her fingers and toes Treatment with morphine is begun and the girl's symptoms are partially relieved. Physical examination shows a raised facial rash. A peripheral blood smear shows severe anemia, and a bone-marrow aspirate shows no erythroid precursor cells Infection with which of the following is most likely responsible for these findings?

A novel infectious disease has become prevalent and increasingly widespread over the past 2 years. The Centers for Disease Control (CDC) has just isolated the cause of the illness which is a virus. The virus looks like a brick-shaped complex. It consists of double-stranded enveloped DNA, which replicates in the cytoplasm via a virion-associated transcriptase. This new virus would be most likely classified in which of the following families?
Choose the correct infective stage of the pathogen shown in the life cycle.

A 38-year-old immigrant from Brazil presents with difficulty swallowing and chest pain. Her vitals and physical examination are unremarkable. Her chest X-ray shows a dilated esophagus and a barium swallow reveals narrowing of the distal esophagus. Manometry demonstrates a nonrelaxing esophageal sphincter and loss of peristaltic movement in the lower esophagus. Pertinent laboratory results include: • Trypanosoma cruzi IgM: negative • Trypanosoma cruzi IgG: positive The causative agent of this disease was most likely transmitted by a:

A 40-year-old HIV-positive woman presents to the emergency department with a 1-week history of fever, malaise, and headache. Earlier that morning, her friend had stopped by to check on her and had found her confused and disoriented and brought her to the emergency department. On physical examination she is lethargic, her heart rate is 70 beats per minute, her blood pressure is 100/60 mm Hg, and her temperature is 38.3°C. Head CT is unremarkable. Other pertinent findings are shown below: CSF analysis: WBCs: 207/mm3; 76% lymphocytes, Glucose: 43 mg/dL, Protein: 150 mg/dL, CD4 T cells: 87 cells/?L After 3 days, yeast is identified from the CSF. Which of the following is most likely be seen microscopically in the CSF?

options.label: B
options.text: Budding yeast with a broad base

options.label: C
options.text: Budding yeast with hyphae and pseudohyphae

options.label: D
options.text: Clusters of yeast with short hyphae

questions.text: A 26-year-old woman presents to the emergency room with confusion, severe myalgia. fever, and rash over her inner left thigh. The patient was diagnosed with pharyngitis three days ago and prescribed antibiotics, but she did not take them. Her blood pressure is 90/60 mm Hg. heart rate is 99/min, respiratory rate 17/min, and temperature 102.0°F. On physical examination. the patient is disoriented. The posterior wall of her pharynx is erythematous and swollen and bulks into the pharyngeal lumen. There is a diffuse maculopapular rash over her thighs and abdomen. Which of these surface structures interacts with the causative agent of her condition?

options.label: D
options.text: Constant part of TCR a-cha in

questions.correct_answer: A. Variable part of TCR B-chain

questions.text: The aim of the 'Mid-day meal' programme is to supplement:

questions.correct_answer: A. Half of the protein and one-third of the daily calorie requirement.

questions.correct_answer: B. Children within the age group of 1 to 19 years are covered in it.

A elderly female sustained Colles’ fracture in her right hand which was properly treated. She now complains of stiffness and severe pain in the wrist with cold sensation and cyanosis in the fingers. X-ray of the hand revealed complete decalcification. She is most likely suffering from –

Linear accelerator for

An Industrial worker was admitted in the hospital with injury to the eye following his work with hammer & chisel, with suspected foreign body in eye. Which of the following investigations will be detrimental?
Which of the following is true about pseudohallucinations?

options.label: A
options.text: They possess the vivid quality of normal perceptions.

options.label: B
options.text: They are dependent on external stimuli.

options.label: D
options.text: They arise in inner subjective space.

questions.correct_answer: D. They arise in inner subjective space.

questions.text: 50-year male presented in emergency in confused state, on examination he is disoriented and responds poorly to stimuli presented and sometimes the response to the stimuli was nil. After recovery he had no recollection of the episode. Above clinical scenario is suggestive of which of the following organic syndrome?

A 60-year-old man is brought to the emergency department by his wife for “confusion.” She reveals that he is a “heavy drinker” and that he has drunk country made liquor almost every day for the past 30 years. Although he has not changed his alcohol intake significantly, over the past year he has eaten less, preferring alcohol to large meals. She has noticed a gradual weight loss as a result. His last drink was earlier that day. Which of the following would be the most likely finding on the mental status examination of this patient?
All of the following suggest a diagnosis of dementia except

A 54-year-old man is admitted to the hospital for elective surgery. He has been through alcohol rehabilitation but has continued to struggle with his drinking. He alerts the primary service taking care of him that he has continued to drink up to the time of his admission. In what time frame after cessation of all drinking is he at most risk for Delirium tremens?

Hearing loss induced by viruses can be congenital or acquired, unilateral or bilateral. Certain viral infections can directly damage inner ear structures, others can induce inflammatory responses which then cause this damage. All of the following pathogens can cause sensorineural hearing loss except:
Choose the most appropriate statement regarding “Examination of the larynx”

options.label: A
options.text: The anterior commissure is easily visualized on indirect laryngoscopy during quiet inspiration.

options.label: B
options.text: Stroboscopy is of most value in studying vocal cords during quiet respiration.

options.label: C
options.text: Anteroposterior tomography is valuable in assessing the degree of spread of subglottic carcinoma.

options.label: D
options.text: A grating sensation on moving the larynx from left to right is abnormal.

questions.correct_answer: C. Anteroposterior tomography is valuable in assessing the degree of spread of subglottic carcinoma.

questions.text: The cochlear amplifier is essentially a positive feedback loop within the cochlea that amplifies the traveling wave .Which of the following best describes the cochlear modifier or amplifier?

options.label: A
options.text: A passive process within the cochlea due to the stiffness of the tectorial membrane

options.label: B
options.text: An active process involving the inner hair cell system to tune the basilar membrane

options.label: C
options.text: Dependent on outer hair cell motility and the mechanical properties of the stereocilia and tectorial membrane

options.label: D
options.text: Allows sound coming in to be tuned across a wide spectral frequency band so that every frequency is stimulated equally

questions.correct_answer: C. Dependent on outer hair cell motility and the mechanical properties of the stereocilia and tectorial membrane

questions.text: A 5-yrs-old child present with a history of repeated episodes of breathlessness since the age of 3 years. For these attacks of breathlessness, the patient had undergone a permanent tracheostomy at the age of 3 years. Study the given laryngoscopic image and choose the most appropriate statement

options.label: A
options.text: Only involves the vocal cords and ventricular bands.

options.label: B
options.text: Is primarily a disease of young adults.

questions.text: During a routine stapedectomy, the facial nerve is found to completely cover the stapes footplate. What is the best option in this setting?

options.label: A
options.text: Decompress the facial nerve and perform a Stapedotomy

options.label: B
options.text: Decompress the facial nerve and perform a stapedectomy

options.label: D
options.text: Stapedotomy between the facial nerve and the round window

questions.correct_answer: C. Amplification with a hearing aid

questions.text: A 30-year-old male patient presented to our OPD with chief complaint of a painless swelling over neck for last 8 months. The size of the swelling was gradually progressive and increased slightly on coughing and Valsalva maneuver. Patient was a farmer by profession with positive history of smoking. Patient also gave history of excision of a neck swelling on the same site. On examination swelling was found to be present on the right side of neck measuring around 4 × 4 cm (Fig. 1) with a scar from the previous surgery.Choose the most appropriate statements regarding the diagnosis: Are caused by dilatation of the subglottis. The external variety project through the thyrohyoid membrane. Can easily be demonstrated with plain X-rays. Early excision is advisable.

A 54-year-old female presented with complaints of sudden onset hearing difficulty and dizziness following a brief flu like illness. She had no accompanying tinnitus, headaches, blurred vision, numbness or weakness of extremities. Physical examination showed no neurological deficits but was significant for bilateral hearing loss. Her routine laboratory investigations were normal. MRI of the brain was within normal limits. Audiogram done for evaluation of hearing difficulty revealed asymmetric bilateral sensorineural deficit, right more than the left. Autoimmune workup was done which was positive for an elevated ANA with titer of 1:160 and a speckled pattern seen on immunofluorescence. She also had positive antibody against 68-kd antigen.Which of the following statement correctly explains “Autoimmune inner ear disease (AIED)”

options.label: A
options.text: A progressive unilateral sensorineural hearing loss (SNHL) that responds to immuno- suppressant therapy

options.label: B
options.text: A progressive bilateral SHNL that responds to immunosuppressant therapy

options.label: C
options.text: A progressive bilateral SNHL that does not respond to immunosuppressant therapy

options.label: D
options.text: A sudden bilateral SNHL that responds to immunosuppressant therapy

questions.correct_answer: B. A progressive bilateral SHNL that responds to immunosuppressant therapy

questions.text: Which of the following electrocochleographic responses is not true for the associated pathology?

options.label: A
options.text: Reduced summing potential/action potential (SP/AP) ratio in superior semicircular canal dehiscence

options.label: B
options.text: Increased SP/AP ratio in Ménière's disease

options.label: C
options.text: Increased SP/AP ratio in perilymph fistula

options.label: D
options.text: Absent in profound sensorineural hearing loss

questions.correct_answer: A. Reduced summing potential/action potential (SP/AP) ratio in superior semicircular canal dehiscence

questions.text: Appropriate statement regarding “Treatment of squamous carcinoma of the tonsil”

options.label: A
options.text: Surgery is of no benefit if there are lymph node metastases.

options.label: B
options.text: Radiotherapy is only given for palliation.

options.label: C
options.text: A pectoralis major myo cutaneous flap can be used to reconstruct after resection of the primary and radical neck dissection.

options.label: D
options.text: Cisplatin has been shown to prolong survival in Phase III trials.

questions.correct_answer: C. A pectoralis major myo cutaneous flap can be used to reconstruct after resection of the primary and radical neck dissection.

questions.text: A 33-year old woman present with intermittent dizziness. The patient describes a sensation of severe spinning accompanied by intense nausea that lasts 1-2 hours. She feels unsteady during these episodes and has to lie down with her eyes closed for relief. The patient has had several similar episodes during the past 2 years and has not noted any particular factors that precipitate the symptoms. She also reports hearing a "mechanical humming" sound in her right ear during these episodes: causing distortion of speech. The patient has no associated headaches: ear pain, or ear discharge. Her temperature is 36.6 C (98 F): blood pressure is 130/84 mm Hg and pulse is 86/min. On examination, air conduction is greater than bone conduction in both ears. When the base of a tuning fork is placed against her forehead, the sound is heard more prominently in the left ear Which of the following is the most likely cause of this patient's condition?

options.label: A
options.text: Benign tumor compressing a cranial nerve

questions.text: A 32-year-old male patient is to be taken for an emergency appendicectomy surgery under general anaesthesia with endotracheal intubation. On airway assessment the patient has a mouth opening of 4.5 CMS with patient able to touch his mentum to chest and on examination of oral cavity one can see the hard palate , soft palate , tonsillar pillars and uvula is visible in majority except the tip. After direct laryngoscopy following picture was seen. Which of the following is the correct statement regarding this patient?

options.label: A
options.text: Anticipated easy intubation and actual difficult intubation

options.label: B
options.text: Anticipated difficult intubation and actual easy intubation

options.label: C
options.text: Anticipated easy intubation and actual easy intubation

options.label: D
options.text: Anticipated difficult intubation and actual difficult intubation

questions.correct_answer: A. Anticipated easy intubation and actual difficult intubation

questions.text: With regards to TOF?

options.label: B
options.text: 4 stimuli given at a gap of 0.4 seconds

options.label: C
options.text: Produces fade when monitoring depolarizing neuromuscular block.

options.label: D
options.text: Should be performed once every 5 s.

questions.text: Fastest acting inhalational anaesthetic agent:

After administration of rocuronium for intubation , a patient develops severe hypotension, bronchospasm, and cyanosis. Which of the following should be used for treatment?
What is the concentration of epinephrine used in resuscitation?

You are called by nursing staff in the newborn nursery concerning a child who is having difficulty feeding. The child was born to a mother with poorly controlled gestational diabetes. The mother’s fasting glucose prior to delivery was 230 mg/dL (normal fasting glucose: 70–110 mg/dL) and cord glucose was 138 mg/dL (normal cord glucose 45?96 mg/dL). The mother has attempted to breastfeed, but the child is reported as hypotonic and mildly irritable with poor suck. No seizure activity is reported. You ask the nurse to obtain a stat blood glucose on the child, which is reported as 28 mg/dL (normal 30–60 mg/dL). Which of the following would be the most appropriate intervention at this time?
questions.correct_answer: A. Administer a 2cc/kg IV of D10W.

questions.text: A 12-month-old girl presents with a history of skin rash, hair loss, poor feeding, nonbloody diarrhea, and decreased activity. Her weight is at the 10 percentile, as compared to the 45 percentile at her 9-month health maintenance visit. On physical examination, in addition to alopecia, there are multiple areas of dry, erythematous, eczematous lesions on her trunk, buttocks, and cheeks. Moist bullous, crusting lesions are present around the mouth and anus. Which of the following is the most likely cause of this patient’s symptoms?
What is the dose of Zinc in acute diarrhea in a 3 months old child?

An irritable and febrile 3-year-old boy with a morbilliform-like rash and bulbar conjunctival injection is hospitalized and subsequently found to have a left coronary artery aneurysm. Which of the following is most likely to be identified during additional evaluation of this patient?

options.label: A
options.text: An intramural duodenal hematoma identified on abdominal ultrasound

options.label: B
options.text: Acute distension of the gallbladder identified on abdominal ultrasound

options.label: C
options.text: A renal artery thrombosis identified on Doppler ultrasound

options.label: D
options.text: Dilation of the aortic root identified on echocardiogram

options.label: E
options.text: Multiple dilated loops of large bowel with bubbly linear gas collections within the bowel wall

questions.correct_answer: B. Acute distension of the gallbladder identified on abdominal ultrasound

questions.text: Which vaccine should be given to a 10 year old child?

A newborn presents with purulent conjunctivitis and pneumonia. Baby has no fever and has normal activity. On the gram stain of the purulent discharge, there is no organism found. What is your diagnosis?

The fetus lives in a relatively hypoxemic environment. The intrauterine circulation consists of two parallel systems that are not completely separated because of mixing at the atrial and ductal levels. The following vessels/chambers have oxygen saturations from HIGHEST to LOWEST:

options.label: A
options.text: Left ventricle > umbilical vein > superior vena cava > right ventricle

options.label: B
options.text: Superior vena cava > umbilical vein > right ventricle > left ventricle

options.label: C
options.text: Umbilical vein > left ventricle > right ventricle > superior vena cava

options.label: D
options.text: Umbilical vein > superior vena cava > right ventricle > left ventricle

questions.correct_answer: C. Umbilical vein > left ventricle > right ventricle > superior vena cava

questions.text: A 14-day old male infant is brought to the Emergency Department because of difficulty feeding, vomiting, and lethargy. Physical examination reveals temperature=37°C, heart rate=190 beats per minute, blood pressure=55/30 (mean=34) mm Hg, and respiratory rate=60 breaths per minute. The infant’s anterior fontanel is sunken and his skin turgor is poor with a capillary refill time of 5 seconds. Which of the following laboratory findings are MOST consistent with the diagnosis of congenital adrenal hyperplasia resulting from 21-hydroxylase deficiency?

options.label: A
options.text: Sodium=124 mEq/L, potassium=6.2 mEq/L, chloride=86 mEq/L

questions.correct_answer: A. Sodium=124 mEq/L, potassium=6.2 mEq/L, chloride=86 mEq/L

questions.text: Which statement about Janz syndrome is not true?

options.label: B
options.text: It is most common epilepsy syndrome in young adults

options.label: C
options.text: Sleep deprivation, alcohol and photic stimulation precipitate it

options.label: D
options.text: EFHC1 gene mutation is seen in 50% of cases of JME

questions.correct_answer: D. EFHC1 gene mutation is seen in 50% of cases of JME

questions.text: Hypoxemia causes a hyperventilation by a direct effect on which of the following?
Which of the following pancreatic secretions has a receptor with four subunits, two of which have tyrosine kinase activity?
A decrease in which of the following parameters in an artery will produce an increase in pulse pressure?

A 12-year-old boy presents with a 4-month history of diminished vision and diplopia. He also experiences tiredness toward the end of the day. He has no other symptoms. On examination, the patient has ptosis of the left eye that improves after a period of sleep. Clinical examination is otherwise normal. No evidence of weakness of any other muscle is found. Testing reveals that the patient has a normal thyroid function and a normal CT scan of the brain and orbit. What is the initial diagnosis?
The second order sensory neuron of the spinothalamic tract id found in which of the following structures?
Most commonly done pure prosthetic repair for inguinal hernia is?

A 25 year old female presented with lower abdominal pain and occasional leucorrhoea. Laparoscopy showed violin string adhesions abound liver and fluid in pouch of Doughlas. What is most probable pathogen for this condition?
Which of the following is not a part of rule of 10 in cleft lip repair?
Burrow’s triangle in advancement flap helps in?
questions.correct_answer: A. Increasing the length of flap

questions.text: False statement about Priapism is?

options.label: A
options.text: Erection lasts for more than 4 hours.

options.label: B
options.text: Low flow priapism can lead to ischemia and impotency

options.label: D
options.text: Ephedrine irrigation is used for treatment

questions.correct_answer: C. Glans is turgid and swollen

questions.text: In inhalational burn Which of the following is not a feature of Acute pulmonary insufficiency seen within 48 hours?

A patient was brought to emergency with a history of beaten in a brawl. He sustained a lathi injury on temporal area of skull. At the time of admission his GCS is 9 and right pupil is dilated with poor light reflex. Ct scan image is given below. Which of the following is false statement about this condition.

options.label: A
options.text: Middle meningeal artery is a common source of this bleed

options.label: B
options.text: Lucid interval may be found with this condition

options.label: C
options.text: Skull fracture is commonly found with this condition

options.label: D
options.text: For severely raised ICT hyperventilation should be done to bring down PaCo2 at around 25mmHg.

questions.correct_answer: D. For severely raised ICT hyperventilation should be done to bring down PaCo2 at around 25mmHg.

questions.text: Edmonton protocol is used for?
Which of the following is not a criterion for Massive blood transfusion?

options.label: A
options.text: Replacement of one entire blood volume within 24 h

options.label: B
options.text: Transfusion of >10 units of packed red blood cells (PRBCs) in 24 h

options.label: C
options.text: Transfusion of >20 units of PRBCs in 24 h

options.label: D
options.text: Replacement of 50% of total blood volume (TBV) within 6 h.

questions.correct_answer: D. Replacement of 50% of total blood volume (TBV) within 6 h.

questions.text: False statement about Hashimoto’s thyroiditis?

options.label: C

options.label: D
options.text: Natural course is brief period of hyperthyroid followed by reversible hypothyroid

questions.text: False statement about kuttner tumour is?

options.label: B
options.text: Association with IgG4 RSS is being linked with etiology

questions.correct_answer: C. Parotid is most commonly involved

questions.text: Not a high risk factor for oral cavity cancer
False statement about breast cancer?

options.label: A
options.text: Some reports have shown association of breast implant with Anaplastic large cell lymphoma (Non-Hodgkin’s BIA-ALCL)

options.label: B
options.text: Stewart Travis syndrome is a Lymphangiosarcoma and may be seen in post mastectomy over chronic lymphedema.

options.label: C
options.text: Oncotype Dx is helpful in deciding need of adjuvant chemotherapy in node negative ER/PR positive small breast cancer

options.label: D
options.text: Von Nuys score helps in deciding need of chemotherapy after surgery in DCIS.

questions.correct_answer: D. Von Nuys score helps in deciding need of chemotherapy after surgery in DCIS.

questions.text: In liver laceration if there is uncontrolled bleeding after Pringles's maneuver what is likely cause?

A 4-month-old infant has undergone surgical treatment for meningomyeloencephalocele. A CT tomogram of head was made immediately after birth. At birth, an operation was carried out in the posterior cranial fossa to partially replace brain cerebellar contents to an intracranial position. In investigations for progressive hydrocephalus, it is noted that there is herniation of the cerebellar tonsils through the foramen magnum. This syndrome may also include which of the following?

options.label: B
options.text: Fusion of the temporal, parietal, and occipital lobes

options.label: C
options.text: Abnormal elongation of the medulla and lower cranial nerves

options.label: D
options.text: Partial or complete absence of the pituitary gland

questions.correct_answer: C. Abnormal elongation of the medulla and lower cranial nerves

questions.text: False statement about hyperacute graft rejection is?

questions.correct_answer: D. More common in Heart and Liver transplant than renal transplant.
